title: Congratulating Christine Driscoll of Geneva High School upon the occasion of winning the New York State Class B Cross Country Championship
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Christine Driscoll of Geneva High
School upon the occasion of winning the New York  State  Class  B  Cross
Country Championship

WHEREAS,  Excellence  and  success in competitive sports can be achieved
only through strenuous practice, team play and team spirit, nurtured  by
dedicated coaching and strategic planning; and
  WHEREAS, Athletic competition enhances the moral and physical develop-
ment of the young people of this State, preparing them for the future by
instilling  in  them  the  value  of teamwork, encouraging a standard of
healthy living, imparting a desire for success and developing a sense of
fair play and competition; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and pay
tribute to those young people within the  State  of  New  York  who,  by
achieving outstanding success in athletic competition, have inspired and
brought pride to their school and community; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to  congratu-
late  Christine  Driscoll  of  Geneva  High  School upon the occasion of
winning the New York State Class B Cross Country Championship; and
  WHEREAS, A young woman of singular distinction and superlative  abili-
ty,  Christine Driscoll, a senior at Geneva High School won the NYSPHSAA
Class B championship on November 13, 2010; out of 124 girls in the race,
she won the 5,000 meter event with a time of 18:23.5; and
  WHEREAS, Two weeks later, Christine  Driscoll  competed  in  the  Foot
Locker  Northeast  Qualifier in hopes of extending her high school cross
country career just a little bit longer; coached by Dale Ladd and  Chuck
Collins,  she  finished the 3.1-mile, Sunken Meadow State Park course in
18:39.5, good enough for 12th place out of 90 girls who ran in the seed-
ed race; and
  WHEREAS, An avid competitor, Christine Driscoll  just  missed  out  on
qualifying for the Foot Locker Cross Country National Championships held
in San Diego, California, by 11.5 seconds; and
  WHEREAS,  Loyally  and enthusiastically supported by family, fans, and
friends, Christine Driscoll has  proven  herself  to  be  an  unbeatable
combination of talents, reflecting favorably on her community; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the values of teamwork, pride and
accomplishment,  and  Christine Driscoll has clearly made a contribution
to the spirit of excellence which is a tradition of her school; and
  WHEREAS, Poised eagerly with enthusiasm and determined purpose, Chris-
tine Driscoll now stands honorably, with just pride in  her  accomplish-
ments  and in eager anticipation of future challenges, understanding and
appreciating the caring counsel and support provided  by  her  teachers,
coaches and parents; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Christine Driscoll of Geneva High School upon the  occasion
of winning the New York State Class B Cross Country Championship; and be
it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Christine Driscoll.
